title: Code like an economist: Analyzing LLMs' code generation capabilities in economics and finance
data:
Z Song, S Wu, Y Zhou- Finance Research Letters, 2025
This study investigates the code generation capabilities of large language models 
(LLMs) in the context of economics and finance research. Using a curated dataset of 
1,088 academic papers from top-tier journals across 19 subfields, we design prompts 
that task a current LLM with generating code to replicate the analytical procedures 
described in each study. We evaluate the generated outputs for accuracy and track 
regeneration behaviors under both autonomous (self-regeneration) and human
Trch dn: Refining chatgpt-generated code: Characterizing and mitigating

title: Generative Trigger-Action Programming with Ply
data:
TJ Aveni, H Mor, A Fox, B Hartmann- Proceedings of the 38th Annual ACM, 2025
Trigger-action programming has been a success in end-user programming. 
Traditionally, the simplicity of links between triggers and actions limits the 
expressivity of such systems. LLM-based code generation promises to enable users 
to specify more complex behavior in natural language. However, users need 
appropriate ways to understand and control this added expressive power. We 
introduce Ply, a system that tackles this challenge through the following
Trch dn: Refining chatgpt-generated code: Characterizing and mitigating

ref: 3 lời trích dẫn mới đến bài viết của Thanh Le-Cong

title: Toward Non-Expert Customized Congestion Control
data:
M Zhang, H Bagheri, L Xu- ICC 2025-IEEE International Conference on, 2025
General-purpose congestion control algorithms (CCAs) are designed to achieve 
general congestion control goals, but they may not meet the specific requirements of 
certain users. Customized CCAs can meet certain users' specific requirements; 
however, non-expert users often lack the expertise to implement them. In this paper, 
we present an exploratory non-expert customized CCA framework, named NECC, 
which enables non-expert users to easily model, implement, and deploy their
Trch dn: Refining chatgpt-generated code: Characterizing and mitigating
